alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:39AM PST until January 10 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, large waves and dangerous surf conditions. Breakers up to 23 feet. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, tidal overflow flooding expected. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to 2 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level, during high tides is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Severe beach erosion may destroy coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying shoreline.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property. A High Surf Warning means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path.
